page.title: 05Wrightington hospital
page.content: Wrightington hospital is situated between Standish and Parbold about six miles northwest of Wigan and stands at an altitude of 300 feet above sea level. The area of the estate is 159 acres. Originally it was Wrightington Hall, an estate dating back to 1282. The end of the last century saw the beginning of decline in Wrightington Hall's fortunes and in 1918 it was bought by Lancashire County Council. Plans and alterations were completed in 1931. It was a custom-built tuberculosis hospital. Today it is renowned for it's joint replacement surgery. There are also departments which deal with chest complaints and physiotherapy. The hospital comprises 14 wards and 3 operating theatres.
